title: manage/timetable: Dragging and dropping contribution fails at incorrect spot
body: Indico 3.3.7 A break was added to the end of the day due to incorrect a. m./p .m., and moving it up, it lagged and then was rendered at an impossible state: The Firefox console has: ``` 11:25:48.290 JQMIGRATE: Migrate is installed, version 3.4.1 jquery.72133055.bundle.js:40:883 11:40:22.219 Uncaught Error: cannot call methods on super_droppable prior to initialization; attempted to call method 'enable' jQuery 5 drag main.72ca8e2b.bundle.js line 1 > eval:338 jQuery 10 121 jquery.72133055.bundle.js:278:33102 11:40:28.119 Uncaught TypeError: can't access property 1, m2 is null dateTimeIndicoToJS main.72ca8e2b.bundle.js line 1 > eval:180 release main.72ca8e2b.bundle.js line 1 > eval:95 drop main.72ca8e2b.bundle.js line 1 > eval:471 _withNoEvents main.72ca8e2b.bundle.js line 1 > eval:272 drop main.72ca8e2b.bundle.js line 1 > eval:467 jQuery 15 main.72ca8e2b.bundle.js line 1 > eval:180:20 dateTimeIndicoToJS main.72ca8e2b.bundle.js line 1 > eval:180 release main.72ca8e2b.bundle.js line 1 > eval:95 drop main.72ca8e2b.bundle.js line 1 > eval:471 _withNoEvents main.72ca8e2b.bundle.js line 1 > eval:272 drop main.72ca8e2b.bundle.js line 1 > eval:467 jQuery 15 ``` No other contributions are clickable, and I probably need to reload the page.

title: Datetime edit does not  work anymore, js issue
body: **Describe the bug** The datetime field does not show anymore to update events in 3.3.7. **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Install indico through docker indico/indico-containers. 2. Create a conference. 3. See error - cant add date. 4. Edit existing conference - cant add date. **Expected behavior** To be able to change the datetime of the event. **Screenshots** **Additional context** Add any other context about the problem here.

title: "Invalid dt" date picker error after updating to v.3.3.7
body: **Describe the bug** After updating to v.3.3.7, some date range pickers fail to load and output the following error to the console: `Error: Invalid dt 2026-04-17`. **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior (on instance updated to v3.3.7): 1. Go to forms with a date range picker, e.g. create new or edit existing Meeting/Conference 2. Open the developer console and notice the `Error: Invalid dt 2026-04-17` 3. By editing the `value` attribute of the `input` in the source HTML with `start_dt-datestorage` and `end_dt-datestorage` with the format `17/04/2026` the form submits successfully. **Expected behavior** The date is injected in the HTML in the expected DD/MM/YYYY format rather than YYYY-MM-DD and the date picker is correctly displayed. **Screenshots** > [!NOTE] > Notice how some date pickers are displayed, while others are not. **Additional context** The instance is running the official v3.3.7 Docker images and all the database migrations have ben run.

title: Messy layout when adding field to registration form
body: **Describe the bug** [I mentioned](https://github.com/indico/indico/issues/7004) that when adding a new field to a registration form, there are fewer field types than if you want to change the field type later. When I went to get screenshots for reporting the bug, I noticed that all the options are actually there, but half of them get rendered off-screen in a way that I never noticed it. So it's more a case of messy UI/UX than actual missing functionality... **Screenshots** Here's what the add-field-dropdown typically looks like on my screen: I only now noticed that the dropdown has a second segment that opens just to the right of my viewport. **Additional context** Linux, Debian 12, chromium 138.0.7204.183, xfce4

title: Uncaught TypeError when saving room information
body:
**Describe the bug**
Indico doesn't save room information via Room Booking. When adding a room to a location or changing information of the room the browser reports: 
"Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'dirty')
    at onSubmit (RoomEditModal.jsx:206:50)"
And the loading icon runs indefinitely, when closing the form, nothing is saved.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to '{your-domain}/rooms/admin/locations/{location_id}'
2. Click on 'Add Room' or Edit an already existing room
3. Add/Edit some information
4. Click "Save"
5. See error

**Expected behavior**
The room is saved.

**Screenshots**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/82184df3-8dd7-4214-944a-5fb5cb9814f5)

title: Unable to send mail in bulk to abstract submitter 422
Date Picker not properly working based on website language selected
body:
**Describe the bug**
It seems that there's a bug while trying to use the date picker component, and depending on the default language selected. For example, while trying to submit a form that contains a date picker field, this specific field won't be able to be properly filled due to a JS issue.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create / use a registration form with a date picker field
2. Switch the default Indico language to Japanese
3. Click on the date picker field

**Expected behavior**
The JS issue should now occur, and the calendar won't appear from the user view. Even when trying to fill the mentioned field manually won't work as expected.

**Screenshots**

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/97c4992e-229d-4c9e-88cf-406accda968e)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c6dca833-6f58-4176-b331-3c2b2e944128)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c8cf90b5-60fb-4cea-8df8-699d4bb7fa92)

title: Email domain does not exist error (sky.com)
body:
**Describe the bug**
Someone on our Indico was unable to register for an event due to an `'The domain used in this email address does not exist'` error message when filling in the registration form. However, I can only reproduce with iPads when you access the site via an email link... (the same as the user who alerted us to this behaviour)

**To Reproduce**
I have tried to reproduce on multiple systems, browsers and devices but like I said I can only seem to reproduce on iPads when accessing the link via emails. 

Macbook safari, chrome, firefox works fine. 
Iphone it worked manually accessing the URL and via email link 

I created a test event here https://indico.ukaea.uk/event/498/ 

**Expected behavior**
User should be able to register for the event with the @sky.com email address

**Screenshots**

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a18b342c-9bde-4ce5-9b1b-d30efc1a7363)

But then the same email address works fine on another system
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7e9e119f-6423-40a3-b488-af5b874ace91)

**Additional context**
Happy to follow up via email if you need the exact email address, however I can't imagine why it would be. I have been emailing back and forth with the user, it is definitely valid.

title: Datepicker in category calendar broken
body:
Besides still using props related to the old react-dates date picker, the new one also doesn't seem to interact nicely with `injectModal`... Ideally we'd just use the normal DatePicker there, but it looks like the calendar library doesn't let you inject arbitrary elements into its toolbar...

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3b8b99e1-6a91-43b1-b456-8b327d6a7020)

body:

The FinalDropDown element is not usable on iOS as when clicking it the system "zooms in" and the dropdown moves out of position.

**To Reproduce**

The values are visible and selectable

title: Improvement to Swedish translation
body: **Describe the bug** I noticed that on an agenda displayed in Swedish, contributions with only one speaker has "Speaker:" replaced with "HÃ¶gtalare" (which means loudspeaker), but when there are several speakers it is correct ("Speakers:" is replaced with "Talare:"). It should be "Talare:" in both singular and plural. I tried to find this in the source since I figured I could submit a PR, but from a quick glance I understand the translation db is handled through https://explore.transifex.com/indico/indico/ which seems messier. So hopefully someone can just fix this quickly. **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to e.g. https://indico.cern.ch/event/1525152/ 2. Set the language to Swedish **Expected behavior** See above **Screenshots** **Additional context** N/A.

title: When using the scroll bar with the mouse in select items in a regform, scrolling does not work

**Describe the bug**
If you use a select item in a regform that has enough items to enable scrolling (like country), the user may scroll with the wheel / touchpad, but if the scroll bar is clicked on to scroll "the old way", the options closes instead of allowing to scroll by clicking.

**To Reproduce**
1. create an event and a regform, add the country field
2. try to scroll via clicking 

**Expected behavior**
scrolling should be possible via scrollbar 

**Additional context**
[sandbox event.](https://sandbox.getindico.io/event/4588/registrations/1570/)

title: Fix positioning style
body: For some unknown reason, dvw/dvh units didn't quite work... err... 100% in some cases. Using 100% instead appears to work well in the cases we have. It's difficult to tell if this is going to have any undesirable side-effects, but we can probably address that as it crops up. This issue was discovered in the time picker PR, but I've separated it here as I might need to adjust things in the other PRs after this lands.

title: Translation of "Select a category" dialog (missing "{0} categories" string from Transifex)
body:
In the "Select a category" dialog (e.g. "Create meeting" from the menu -> press "Choose category" button) the popup text, which appears when a mouse pointer is hovered over the number of categories and events on the right hand side of each row in the dialog, is **partially translated**. The text is "{0} categories | {0} events" with numbers inserted instead of "{0}" and single or plural form of the word "category"/"event" used.

The problem is that the "{0} events" part of that string is properly translated, while the "{0} categories" always stays in English.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to "Create meeting" in the main menu
2. Click on "Choose category" button
3. Hover mouse pointer over the numbers on the right hand side of any row in the dialog
4. See mixed-language text in the popup (see the screenshot for reference)

Or just search for `"{0} categories"` on Transifex and see that it is missing.

**Expected behavior**
The text of the popup should be fully translated.

**Screenshots**
German translation is used because on Transifex it is 100% translated, so no English words should be present (in theory)
![2024-12-01_21-33-52](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a75c2da9-ed9c-4b33-8d3a-22f4dc606486)

**Additional context**
 I assume that the code is located here: [indico/web/client/js/jquery/widgets/categorynavigator.js](https://github.com/indico/indico/blob/4fa81c297f4c08d5b842e420a26125627c5bc4cd/indico/web/client/js/jquery/widgets/categorynavigator.js#L300). So the issue might be with `indico/web/client/js/jquery/widgets/categorynavigator.js` missing from Transifex. The "{0} events" substring is present in Transifex as it appears also in `indico/modules/categories/client/js/display.js`, but the "{0} categories" substring seems to be unique to `categorynavigator.js`.

title: Migration from from 2.2.4 to 3.3.4 -> HTML formatting issues
body: **Describe the bug** I successfully migrated an Indico 2.2.4 instance to a freshly installed Indico 3.3.4 by creating a PostreSQL dump and restoring them on a clean instance. The only problem I have observed (so far) is that the HTML formatting is incorrect. Apparently, HTML code inside descriptions is escape, which results in HTML-comments showing up in visible text. See screenshots below. What is the proper way to migrate these? **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: Create database dump with `pg_dump -F c indico > indico.dump` from Indico 2.2.4 with PostgreSQL 9.6.24 Transfer the `archive/` folder to the new instance (irrelevant for this issue) Restore the database using `pg_restore -U indico -C -d postgres indico.dump`, which showed some errors but those were "ignored" ``` root@69d6c701fbad:/# pg_restore -U indico -C -d postgres indico.dump pg_restore: error: could not execute query: ERROR: schema "public" already exists Command was: CREATE SCHEMA public; pg_restore: error: could not execute query: ERROR: role "postgres" does not exist Command was: ALTER SCHEMA public OWNER TO postgres; pg_restore: warning: errors ignored on restore: 2 ``` Run `indico db upgrade` and `indico db --all-plugins upgrade` -> both were running fine ``` (.venv) indico@a129602bf89d:~$ indico db upgrade Fontconfig error: No writable cache directories Fontconfig error: No writable cache directories ... title: Retain original order of the Keywords and Label fields in the function Edit keywords and label in Event editing
body:
I'm always frustrated when editing Keywords and Label (in all Event Types), when the order of the fields switches after the edit pencil icon is clicked.

See image below for what the screen looks like before the edit pencil icon is selected (![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/20797c3a-b153-4c96-956e-12710d636b9a)

Order of fields on the pre-edit page:
1. Keywords field
2. Label field


Once the edit pencil icon is selected (see image below), the order changes to:
1. Label field
3. Label message field
4. Keywords field

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/650fdba3-4ec2-407e-9fc5-b161d236d720)

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I would like the fields to be the same order on both the pre-edit page and edit page:

For example:
1. Keywords
2. Label field
3. Label message field

I don't care what order the fields are in but they should retain their order in editing.

Thanks very much in advance from your users.

title: Safari causes issues with `DateInput` component
body:
Safari seems to send a different date format to the `DateInput` component in our registration forms, which raises a confusing validation error. Instead of formatting dates with a `-` separator, Safari chooses to use `/`, which breaks our validation check.

See below (comparing this with Chrome):
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f839ecdc-35e8-41df-b4ad-7e2d7525be1f)

title: Translation error in German roombooking error message when trying to book an already booked timeslot
body:
**Describe the bug**
See issue title, not much else to say about it.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Select a room (e.g. from the bookings overview)
2. Start a booking and select a timeslot which is already booked
3. An error message is displayed: "Raum kann nicht reserviert werden. Der Raum ist in dem/den ausgewÃ¤hlten Zeitfenster(n) frei"

**Expected behavior**
The second sentence of the translation seems to be missing a "nicht" or other negation to indicate that the room is in fact not free to book at the selected timeslot.
(The English error message is: "Space cannot be booked. One or more bookings would conflict with yours.")

title: Switching room booking calendar from month view to week back to month changes view to be the previous month
body:
**Describe the bug**

When you start on the default day view, then switch to month view, then week view, then back to the month view, you end up on the previous month. Users find this confusing. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'room booking' (/rooms/book)
2. Click on 'bookings' (/rooms/calendar)
3. Click on 'Month' (/rooms/calendar?date=2024-06-01&mode=months&view=timeline)
4. Click on 'Week' (/rooms/calendar?date=2024-05-26&mode=weeks&view=timeline)
5. Click on 'Month' (/rooms/calendar?date=2024-05-01&mode=months&view=timeline)

You are now looking at the month view for the previous month, but that would be unexpected for the user. 

**Expected behavior**
If the month view is the current month, when switching to the week view, show the current week. 

The behavior of FullCalendar in the Events section is more intuitive.  It tracks an anchor date for the calendar (I'm not sure of what that's called in FullCalendar's api). 

Examples behavior for FullCalendar: 

- When you first start, the anchor date is "today" so if you switch from Month, to Week, it shows the current week. When you switch back to "day" it shows today. 
- In the month view, if you go back a month, the new anchor date is the first of the previous month, so if you switch to the week view it shows the week with that day in it, but if you switch to the day view, it shows the 1st of the month

title: Date Field in Registration Form Only Shows Previous and Next 5 years
body:
When trying to use Date field in a registration form for date of birth, users are only able to choose from the previous or next 5 years.

Some people think that you cannot put a date below 2019... which is complicated for a date a birth.

Of course, when you type the date it works. 

Is this normal behaviour or should the list of years be scrollable ?

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a new registration form
2. Add a Date field
3. Try to complete the registration form as a user
4. See problem

**Screenshots**
![IPrpvaJzh3BoeOAE](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/10201770/ed820bef-9d8a-44ae-8756-e46a33bf4c28)

title: Using "Import" feature silently fails to fetch event information for unlisted events
body:
**Describe the bug**
Creating an event and trying to "Import" parts of an unlisted events by pasting the URL of the unlisted event does not show any UI response (i.e. event is not "shown" / no error is shown, can not proceed). 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create an unlisted event with some content, e.g. registration forms, which you want to import into another event. 
2. Enter the event you want to import data into, click on the cog-wheel, then choose "Import". 
3. Paste the URL from the unlisted event. 
4. No event shown / can not proceed (also, no error shown). If there already was an error message present e.g. from a previously entered URL, it remains there. 

**Expected behavior**
Either an error message should be shown (i.e. "can not import from unlisted events"), or the unlisted event should be found correctly and it should be possible to import from it. 

**Screenshots**
![grafik](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/166759/418ca52f-d719-4a3f-80c9-1b4b0d1a8579)

**Additional context**
Listing the unlisted event, without any further changes, the import functionality starts to work.

title: Prevent 'mark as paid' for pending registrations
body:
When a registration is moderated and there is a fee or paid items, if you first mark a registration as paid and only then approve it it gets into a strange state where at the top it says not paid but at the same time the invoice shows up as paid.
(More context in a SNOW ticket: INC3861152)

![image](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/8739637/4f9fe133-b818-4e7b-b8e6-1aef240e2572)

Marking as paid should probably be disabled when the registration is still `pending`.

title: Ambiguous "Email" action
body:
**Describe the bug**
The first entry in the 'Actions' menu in the 'Registration' page is labelled 'Email' while it's used to send email to participants. As far as I can say, even if the context helps, this is a bit weird in English.

However, it's really weird in French (I mainly use this language) where it says "Adresse Ã©lectronique", literally "email address" (singular). According to my Italian and Spanish colleagues, the respective translation in those languages are weird too.

Note that this is not just a purist issue: this weird phrasing makes hard to find the feature.

I have attached screenshots for those languages (and suggestions below).

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Registration'
2. Click on a registration list
3. Select one or more participants
4. Click on 'Actions'
5. See the first entry

**Expected behavior**

From my understanding and discussion with my colleagues, I would say:
- in English: "Send email"
- in French: "Envoyer un courrier Ã©lectronique" (to stay coherent with other usages)
- in Italian: "Inviare une email"
- in Spanish: "Enviar un correo electrÃ³nico"

Other entries in the 'Action' menu have similar structure.

**Screenshots**

English:
![en](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/4348913/ac3537d3-22cb-4e99-8e25-57786cce8cf2)

French:
![fr](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/4348913/75d2e99d-0303-45e7-b38e-c0a84cd660b5)

Italian:
![it](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/4348913/0ca706d7-3443-4a0b-adad-04945fb722f9)

Spanish:
![es](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/4348913/11c6943b-ca4d-4cb1-a1a2-e2d6380af03c)

**Additional context**

I don't know much about translations but AFAIK this entry use the "Email" message which is used in several files. Maybe we need to differentiate the email address and the action of sending an email.

Note that there is a "Send emails" message which is almost what we need.

title: Nested lists no longer indented correctly
body:
This comes from one of the PRs that were merged into `a11y` and recently into `master`:

The most problematic place where this happens is in the event description and in minutes:

I'm not sure if one of the existing a11y PRs fixes this, but a separate PR (against `master`) for this would be appreciated because the current state is certainly broken and users will likely complain once we put that live... :/

PS: Another - minor - UI regression which is probably also caused by removing the default list margins is on the event (and category) log pages in management: The "Show...", log item list, and pagination widget are now much more squeezed together.

title: Show error indicator for Yes/No field in registration form
body: **Problem with registration form** Unfortunately, there is no message if you have not answered a mandatory question or, for example, in the case of selection questions with radio buttons, the text appears in red, but unfortunately this does not happen with the mandatory yes/no questions. **Expected behavior** There should be any pop-up warning or the red alerts for the required fields so that users can understand why the form is not getting submitted. **Screenshots** If some suggestions are their kindly answer as soon as possible. Thank you.

title: [A11Y] Registration form fields are not associated with the respective labels
body:
**Describe the bug**

The form fields on the registration page are not associated with the respective labels. This includes (but not limited to):

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to a registration form using a screen reader
2. Focus any control
3. Observe that the field name is not announced

**Expected behavior**

The field name is announced.

**Additional context**

https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/labels-or-instructions.html

title: Submit New Abstact Form: user forced to re-fill the form when 2+ authors and, speaker or contribution type or track is required but not chosen.
body:
When a user goes to submit an abstract and there are two or more authors. If a speaker or a contribution type or a track is required and one is not selected the form fails and the authors list becomes blank with no way to add authors. The user must cancel and re-fill out the form.

**To Reproduce**
1. Allow and Require a speaker and a contribution type and a track in the submission settings.
2. User clicks on 'Submit New Abstract' button
3. Fill in the form with **more than one author**. It does not seem to matter how the authors are entered (manually, search...), just that there are 2 or more. It works as expected with a single author.
4. Do not select one or more of: author as speaker, contribution type, or track.
5. Hit Submit

It will give an error message, but the authors list is empty with no way to add any. The form must be canceled and restarted.

It works as expected with a single author. It also works with multiple authors if none of the above errors occur.

**Expected behavior**
It should give an error message saying a speaker wasn't selected (or contrib. type or track) and let you select one.

**Screenshots**
![screen-speaker-error](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/20404184/fcd0a14b-b357-4740-b2c5-46653dba2a2a)
![screen-speaker-error-1](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/20404184/f9662413-e5be-41fb-94df-e6b7279e53f5)


**Additional context**
Indico v3.2.8 running on Debian Bullseye

I have not tried various combinations of speaker/contrib. type/track being required. They were all required on the event where the error appeared.

title: [UX] Arrow icon alignment issue
body: **Describe the bug** Arrow icons are misaligned following the audible icons fix:

title: Some icons are audible
body:
**Describe the bug**

The current icon set contains characters that are in the screen-reader-readable range causing them to be read out loud (e.g., '$', 'F', etc.).

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to the main page, making sure that there are categories shown with the "right arrow" icon
2. Use a screen reader to read the category page
3. Observe that the arrow is read out as "F"

**Expected behavior**

Icons should not be announced.

title: [A11Y] Search results tabs are inaccessible
body:
**Describe the bug**

The search result type tabs are not accessible using keyboard, and their role in relation to the result is unclear.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Go to category display page
2. Enter a search keyword and confirm
3. On the search page, try to access the tabs using a keyboard
4. Observe that the tabs are not focusable

**Expected behavior**

Tabs are accessible using the keyboard, and their role is correctly announced as "tab" by the screen readers.

**Additional context**

- https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/info-and-relationships.html
- https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/keyboard.html

title: [A11Y] "Skip access checks" checkbox not reachable by keyboard
body:
**Describe the bug**

The "Skip access checks" checkbox cannot be reached by tab navigation.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to main page as an admin user
2. Enter some text in the search box
3. Use the Tab key to attempt to focus the checkbox
4. Observe that checkbox is skipped in focus order

**Expected behavior**

Checkbox should receive focus right after the search box

**Additional context**

- https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/keyboard

title: [A11Y] Status messages are not announced in the search app
body:
**Describe the bug**

When searching, status messages (e.g., "No result") are not announced by the screen reader.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to the search page with screen reader turned on
2. Type a bogus keyword into the search field
3. Observe that the "No result" message is shown but screen reader does not announce it

**Expected behavior**

Screen reader announces the status messages.

**Additional context**

- https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/status-messages.html
- https://talk.getindico.io/t/status-message-search-app-live-notices/3274

title: [A11Y] Search bar/box don't have accessible labels
body:
**Describe the bug**

Search bar only has a placeholder but no label.

**Additional context**

- https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/labels-or-instructions

title: Subcontribution description is not shown
body:

On http://indico.dev1/event/1/contributions/2/subcontributions/3 , the subcontribution description is not shown.

title: [A11Y] Missing bypass block link
body:
**Describe the bug**

The pages are missing a bypass block link (the "Skip to content").

**To Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to any page
2. Press Tab to navigate
3. Observe that the first focused item is not a bypass block link

**Expected behavior**

Expected the first focused item to be a link to the main content.

**Additional context**

- https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/bypass-blocks.html
- https://talk.getindico.io/t/navigation-bypass-blocks/3203

title: [A11Y] Timezone list markup improvements
body:
**Describe the bug**

Timezone selector's behavior currently suffers from several issues related to keyboard interaction. It could also use some UX improvements as well.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

Scenario A:

1. Go to any page which has a time zone selector
2. Focus the timezone button using a keyboard
3. Open the timezone popup by pressing Enter/Return or Spacebar
4. Try to navigate into the timezone popup
5. Observe that navigation "skips" the timezone popup

Scenario B:

1. Click at the top of the timezone popup so that further keyboard navigation will start from the top of the popup
2. Focus the radios
3. Select the "Specify a timezone" radio
4. Observe that the focus is automatically moved to the select list below

**Expected behavior**

When the popup is expanded, the keyboard focus should move to the popup *when the user presses Tab key* (not automatically).

When the "Specify a timezone" radio is selected, focus should *not* automatically move to the select list.

There are also several issues with the semantics of the markup which I will address in a patch for this issue.

**Additional context**

- https://talk.getindico.io/t/keyboard-navigation-session-bar-timezone-picker/3197/3
- https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/keyboard.html

title: [A11Y] Language selector markup
body:
**Describe the bug**

The language selector is inaccessible due to missing `href` on the anchor tags. Furthermore it is semantically incorrect as language switching is not linking to anything.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to main page
2. Attempt to tab into the language selector
3. Observe that tab navigation skips over the language links

**Expected behavior**

The language links/buttons are focusable and operable using keyboard.

**Additional context**

- https://talk.getindico.io/t/keyboard-language-selector/3219
- https://talk.getindico.io/t/language-language-selector/3207
- https://talk.getindico.io/t/instructions-language-selector/3211
- https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/keyboard.html
- https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/labels-or-instructions
- https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/language-of-page.html

title: Some purged regform fields show falsy value instead of nothing

I think this is because we need to have some value that's considered valid, but maybe we could simply not show the value if the field is marked as purged...

title: [A11Y] Replace the qtip2 integration in the navigation toolbar
body:
**Describe the bug**

The navigation toolbar at the top of the page currently uses the qtip2 library to show the lower-level items. This results in code that is not quite accessible.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to main page
2. Note that `a.arrow.js-dropdown` does not have appropriate ARIA attributes to indicate its state/purpose

**Expected behavior**

Expect `a.arrow.js-dropdown` to have `aria-controls` pointing to the menu items, and `aria-expanded` that reflects its state.


**Additional context**

- https://talk.getindico.io/t/ui-state-toolbar-navigation-menu/3216/7
- https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/name-role-value.html

title: Relative dates in "News" section on start page broken in German translation
body:
**Describe the bug**
A picture says more than 1000 words:
![Indico_German_Date](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/166759/b4f7dfb3-561c-4538-80bf-576a52173af1)

It seems the relative date is formatted wrongly, i.e. it reads:
` VerÃ¶ffentlicht am â€œ53tMESZt3râ€ Mittwoch `
instead of:
` VerÃ¶ffentlicht am letzten Mittwoch `

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Add a news message for which a relative date will be used, e.g. within the last week. 
2. Use timezone `Europe/Berlin`. 
3. Visit Indico start page and select German language. 

**Additional Information**
Using a different timezone, e.g. UTC, yields:
` VerÃ¶ffentlicht am â€œ53tUTCt3râ€ Mittwoch `

Switching to English shows:
` Posted Last Wednesday `
as expected.

title: Room administration: "notification_emails" field is often shown empty even if mails are set
body:
**Describe the bug**
After entering and saving mail addresses in the field `notification_emails` in the room booking administration when editing a room's details (on the page "Notifications", labelled "Notification emails"), the field is often shown as "empty" (i.e. with the standard placeholder text) when entering the same menu again. Opening the page up many times, sometimes the actual content is shown. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to "Room Booking", enter "Administration" via the hamburger menu, then click on a location and edit a room via the pen. 
2. Click on "Notifications". 
3. Enter a mail address in the field "Notification emails" and save it. 
4. Completely refresh the page / re-enter room booking administration, i.e. repeat step 1. 
5. Click on "Notifications" again. 
6. The field is shown empty, in about 1 out of 5 attempts. 

**Expected behavior**
Field content to be shown every time. 

**Additional context**
Tested with Firefox 111.0 on Linux, colleagues using Firefox can also reproduce it. 
Testing with Google Chrome 112 on Linux, the chance to see the content of the field seems higher (about 4 in 5 times, the content is visible). 

Checking with web developer tools, the JSON response always contains the field content, so this is likely something furhter down the road, i.e. some kind of race condition in Javascript? 

Note: This is with Indico v3.2.3.

title: Paragraphs in editors are missing spacing
body:
**Describe the bug**
When you write something in a ck editor, e.g. conference description, there is no visible difference between a line break and a paragraph. When you view it in the result, there is however. This is mildly confusing.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create an event with a description. Add some text, a few line breaks, a paragraph
2. Save the description
3. Compare what you see in the editor with the final result

**Expected behavior**
Paragraph spacing in the editor

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/607198/212900832-c2785c21-4a3d-4a0b-a97a-f0d5c65aa01b.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/607198/212900867-17544fdb-6080-4a45-8589-67407d1b5921.png)

**Additional context**
This apparently goes back to this change https://github.com/indico/indico/commit/1541785758f00be132caaa1bfa53a6d85a3e9045 for IE, which I guess we could revert? At the very least, removing that CSS rule will make it default to semantic-ui's 1em margin-bottom.

title: Check `.infoline i` CSS rule usage
body:
This completely breaks the looks when using italic text (CKEditor5 uses `<i>` instead of `<em>` ðŸ˜ ).

Maybe the rule is too generic and only needs to be applied to `i.icon-...`?


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/179599/211537882-9b506246-adb2-4f58-9a1e-9a2bea0d11d0.png)

title: Line breaks in description are ignored in reminders
body:
**Describe the bug** Indico v3.2.1 and newer ignores line breaks and paragraph changes in the description block of reminder emails. This problem did not occur with version 3.2 and earlier. **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Create an event with a multi-line/multi-paragraph description, e.g.: ```

Title: Lecture I

Speaker: Speaker I (Institute I)

Abstract: First things first.

``` if viewed as a html source. 2. Add a reminder 3. Tick the __Include description__ option 4. __Preview email__ 5. The description block displays the above three paragraphs in a single line: ``` Description ----------- Title: Lecture ISpeaker: Speaker I (Institute I)Abstract: First things first. Note ---- ======== zoom connection ============================================= Link, meeting ID and passcode are available on the indico page. ====================================================================== -- Indico :: Email Notifier ``` **Expected behavior** Indico v3.2 would format the description block like: ``` Description ----------- Title: Lecture I Speaker: Speaker I (Institute I) Abstract: First things first. ``` **Additional context** The note block is still intact.

title: event description and custom page content html tag attributes
body:
**Describe the bug** in older versions of indico, I could create custom event sites and custom pages via switching to source mode in the editor and paste my custom html with many class attributes and then style them with a custom layout css file. now, on indico 3.2, these customized events still display correctly, but the new editor removes all my custom attributes and tags I was using, hence changes or a completely new site with custom styled tags are not possible anymore. **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: create an event try to set custom html, i.e. `
hello
` **Expected behavior** on saving, indico should keep the html as entered when the editor was set to source mode. this worked in older indico versions (2.8 or 3.0? not sure unfortunately) **Screenshots** here is the old html I created in the older indico version, and styled it with the custom layout css ![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45198837/203851567-55a478b0-6a23-4bcc-bfb1-60e029366313.png) heres what the description editor loads when trying to edit it. if I would save now, all my custom classes would be gone. ![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45198837/203851661-90b4d4eb-bf2c-409f-ad3f-71644e5c7441.png) any possibility to get this functionality back, aka dont sanitize too much? or add a button where I can upload a custom html and use it i.e. as the event descripton or as content of a custom page. thanks alot!

title: Workflow for creating an event for unauthorized users
body: Using Indico 3.2.2, the permissions for a category are set to only allow creating events for authorized users. Non-administrators still see the *Create event* button, and only get informed about the missing permissions after filling out the form, and trying to create the event.

title: Failed login message: Anmeldung fehlgeschlagen: [error]
body:
Using Indico 3.2.2, if providing incorrect credentials, and trying to log in using LDAP, the error is:

    Anmeldung fehlgeschlagen: [error]

In the log it says:

    2022-08-25 09:36:35,370  WARNING  37654e7b0fa34280  -       indico.auth               Invalid credentials (ip=X, provider=ldap): No such user

or

    2022-08-25 09:32:35,228  WARNING  4aeb1fe5702a46ef  -       indico.auth               Invalid credentials (ip=X, provider=ldap): Invalid credentials

Could that string be used instead? (No idea, if it should be generalized to not allow somebody to check for valid user names.)

title: Modify string for the description of the fields.
body:
**Change string under the registration form management area for the fields **
The following two strings describing the field must be replaced:

1. Publish registrations
2. Publish number of registrations
The existing description is "Registrations from this form will be displayed **in** the event page" & "Number of registered participants will be displayed **in** the event page". The preposition "**in**" must be replaced by "**on**".

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'https://v2-reg-demo.unog.ch/event/396/manage/registration'
3. Under the list of registration forms, click on '**Manage**'
4. Click on Edit in front of the General settings
5. Scroll to the fields "Publish registrations" & "Publish number of registrations"
6. See the error in the description of the aforementioned two fields.

**Expected behavior**
The description string preposition must be replaced from "in the event" to "on the event page" for both fields.

**Screenshots**

![2022-08-05_152535](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88734005/183086910-08ef9e6d-6489-4468-9dd1-da886c6a564e.png)

title: User Management/Users: Claims there are two users despite only one being there
body:
$ git log --no-decorate --oneline -1
    c6b5a3042a Fix showing nonbookable period outside admin UI

With the admin account going to *User Management* â†’ *Users*, it says:

> There are 2 users, 0 of which are deleted

To my knowledge there is only one account though. (LDAP setup is still in the works.)

title: Categories not showing up when creating an event from the homepage
body:
If I try to create an event from the home page (https://indico.cern.ch/), clicking on Create Event -> Meeting the only possible categories shown under "Choose a category" are Directorate under Home.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14352721/175497125-f180501c-ac96-4e91-bea1-cc8333fa0f58.png)

This behaviour changes depending from which page I'm creating the event from. E.g. if I try to create an event from https://indico.cern.ch/category/2/ I can select the "TEST" category, but only that one, and if I try to go "up a level" in the cateogry browser, I'm again stuck with only Home -> Directorate

title: parallel sessions' contibutions are scrambled
body:
**Describe the bug**
Detailed timetable of parallel sessions is scrambled when selecting "detailed view"

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to https://indico.cern.ch/event/1083758/timetable/#20220629
2. Scroll down to the evening parallel sessions and see their structure
3. Scroll up and click on the "Detailed view" button
4. Scroll down to the evening parallel sessions
5. See the error, i.e. that the session contributions are now scrambled

**Expected behavior**
The detailed view should respect the parallel sessions' structure

**Screenshots**

[1] parallel sessions' structure (GOOD)
![image1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33388350/175026765-5b030110-e4d7-48cf-89b2-5fa857e23da5.png)

[2] In "Detailed view", parallel sessions' contibutions are scrambled
![image2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33388350/175026995-50687a5b-52d8-481b-aacf-b218181ddaef.png)

title: Error when user double clicks "Create my Indico Profile" when creating new account
body: **Describe the bug** A database error occurs when a user clicks on the "Create my Indico Profile" button more than once **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behaviour: 1. Go to 'http://127.0.0.1:9000/register/' 2. Input an email address to get verification link 3. Click on the link sent and input user details 4. When done, double click on "Create my Indico Profile" 5. See error **Expected behaviour** The action should not be called again when the button is clicked for the second time, we could disable the button after the first click. **Screenshots**

title: Registration field "choice" resets input type on edit
body:
When editing a "Choice" field in a registration form, the "input type" always resets to "drop down", even if it was previously "radio group"

**To Reproduce**
1. Add a Choice field in a registration form
2. Set the input type to "radio group" and save
3. Now edit with "configure field"
4. The "input type" will be reset to "drop down" if other changes are saved

**Expected behavior**
Editing a Choice field should not change the input type, unless this is explicitly switched by the user

**Context**
Behaviour observed with the current production Indico at CERN, `v3.1.1-pre`

title: category search results list contains categories that have been previously deleted
body:
**Bug Description**
when I search for category (i.e. I'm moving an event to another category) and I type a category name, I get in the result set all the occurrences of that category even if it has been removed (once or many times).
As shown here:
![category_search](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5447192/145198908-20d8aa24-fd01-4fc4-8c1e-8bffe6256fcc.png)

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to a conference page
2. Click on "Event action" and then "Move"
3. "Select a category" will appear
4. Type a category that has been deleted from the system, once or more times
5. In the results list you will get a row the category for every time it has been created (and deleted)  

**Expected behavior**
Category search results should not include categories that have been removed by the system

title: Untranslatable string: Customize contribution list
body:
**Describe the bug**
In 3.0.2, when you open the list of contributions as admin and click the filter icon, you are presented with a window "Customize contribution list". Transifex doesn't show this string as translatable, though.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Make a Conference
2. In Administrative view, click on Contributions (under Organisation)
3. Click the filter icon
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
The string should be translatable.

title: Adding many authors (~30) in abstract submission makes reordering extremely slow
body:
**Describe the bug**

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Go to an abstract submission page
2. Add around 30 authors
3. Try to move a single author up or down the list

**Expected behavior**

Authors just reorders

**What happens instead**

Dragging the author works until you release your mouse upon which the page slows down so much that firefox shows the following warning

**Screenshots**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13602468/132982313-37a9b004-39a1-4b3a-89ba-9e90863cbbec.png)


**Additional context**

Firefox 78.0.2 (64-bit)

title: "Convener" tag name not localizable
body:
**Describe the bug**
The reviewing area shows labels "Reviewer" and "Convener" where appropriate for a given user, so it's clear who can handle what in which track. For some reason, the string "Convener" is not localizable via Transifex - search for it returns nothing.
"Reviewer" is there just fine.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a conference with tracks
2. Try to assign roles to the users using the Roles in abstract submission setup
3. Switch to some other localization, like Turkish
4. See the "Convener" string stand out in the page.

**Expected behavior**
"Convener" string should be localizable.

title: Access rights mismatch - people with rights for "Registrations" see Payments tab, but get Access denied
body:
**Describe the bug**
I have a conference with Manual and Bank transfer payment modules enabled.
A person has been granted Access and Registration rights using the Protection/Event protection tabs.
Now, she can enter the Management area and sees two tabs - Payments and Registrations.
But clicking on the Payments tab yields "You are not authorised to manage this event.".

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Make a conference
2. Enable payments, manual payment and Bank transfer module
3. Make a registration form that results in money to be wired
3. Add a person from accounting department with rights for Registration and explain her that she will handle registration payments.
4. Let the user login and go to the management area.
5. Let the user click Payments
6. Run, Forest, run! Because the "You are not authorised" error will be displayed and the person will get confused.

**Expected behavior**
The payments tab should not be visible if the person has no right to access it.

title: Localization: Country names
body:
**Describe the bug**
When registration includes list of contry names, it uses English versions of their names.
For an event held in a different language this is unpleasant.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a conference with a participant registration
2. In participant registration form, see the values in the Country drop down menu

**Expected behavior**
Country names should respect the event language.

title: Link leading to nonexistent page in indico/web/templates/forms/markdown_widget.html
body:
**Describe the bug**
When submitting new abstract, the user is shown a hint that "You can use Markdown and LaTeX math formulae." And the LaTeX link points to a nonexistent page, because the MathJax documentation evolved and now the page doesn't exist.

The nonexistent link is in `indico/web/templates/forms/markdown_widget.html` points to `https://docs.mathjax.org/en/latest/tex.html#supported-latex-commands` â€“ but it should point to `https://docs.mathjax.org/en/latest/input/tex/macros/index.html` or more generally to `https://docs.mathjax.org/en/latest/input/tex/index.html`.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open abstract submission workflow
2. On the right of the Abstract submission workflow there is an info icon - when you click on it, a hit appears with two links.
3. Click on the LaTeX link
4. See the message about non-existent link appear.

**Expected behavior**
A link should point to a HTML page that exists.

**Additional context**
MathJax documentantion has been restructured and now the link should point elsewhere.

title: Localization: Date format in header should be locale dependent
body:
**Describe the bug**
Currently, in event header, the date is formatted using the format_event_date macro.
This macro relies on English locale custom for formatting the event date, which may not be OK for non-English languages.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to main page of an event.
2. Switch to a different language
3. See the date format in the event header stay the same, e.g. 1-13 listopada for Polish.

**Expected behavior**
The date format should reflect the language, e.g. probably be set by a translation template.
For Czech it would be 12.â€“14. zÃ¡Å™Ã­ (for example).

**Additional context**
The macro in question is in modules/events/templates/display/conference/_util.html

title: TypeAhead Widget not working with some Validators, like HiddenUnless
body:
**Describe the bug**
When you combine TypeAhead Widget with attributes for validators added at render_field function, it won't work because those validators won't be added 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to any registration form (in my case, I went to RegistrationFormForm)
2. Add a first (A) StringField with HiddenUnless validator and TypeaheadWidget
3. Add a second (B) StringField only with HiddenUnless validator
4. Activate the field that triggers the HiddenUnless, it will only work on B.

**Expected behavior**
I expect the HiddenUnless validator (and other extra validators) to work in combination with Typeahead widget.

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11741165/130426378-0acd5409-b088-454a-9e5f-3969e9b78c57.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11741165/130426268-30742d8f-a0d9-4f5b-9f13-d53d6d96d432.png).


**Additional context**
I'm not sure if this issue is afecting to more widgets. For example I think it is afecting to the ckeditor_widget, but I have not tested it.

title: User-visible 403 error on paper reviewing timeline
body:
When viewing the paper timeline (as a reviewer) the request that checks for the status of an Editable can return a 403 error which triggers an error dialog.

We probably need to silence 403 errors there as we do with 404 errors ("no editable exists") for this request - while submitters always have access to this particular endpoint, someone who's just a paper reviewer won't (and it's not relevant for them).

title: Multi-choice option order in regform summary
body:
> We have added a multi-choice field to the registration form, so that participants can tick the workshops they want to participate in during the conference. The ticking works well, but we still have two problems:

> In the summary the participants receive after their registration, the choices are not sorted in the same order that they were sorted in the registration form: In the form, we sorted them chronologically, but in the summary, they appear to be sorted alphabetically, which makes it confusing for participants, as it does not reflect the time schedule anymore.

I haven't tried to reproduce it, but it sounds like a bug...

title: Parts of the registration form are not localized
body:
**Describe the bug**
Parts of the registration form and e-mails do not reflect language settings (tried Spanish, French, Czech). These are:
- *Field names* (e.g. First name, â€¦) â€“Â they seem defined in Transifex, but not translated in the form. I understand that mess will occur universally, when someone defines a new unknown field.
- If the registration is done by manager, there is a section called "Email notification"
- Last two lines in the registration form:
```
(All the fields marked with * are mandatory)
Register
```
- In the e-mail sent with registration details, part of the text is hardcoded, seems to come from modules/events/registration/templates/emails/registration_creation_to_registrant.html

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Login as Indico user
2. Click on Registration
3. Fill it
3. Scroll down.
4. See error, read mail, see error

**Expected behavior**
Register button text and the note before it should be localizable.

title: Paper Editing UI: Misleading "refresh" symbol next to uploaded file name
body:
**Describe the bug**

After uploading my paper I clicked the "refresh" symbol ([similar to this](https://cdn2.vectorstock.com/i/1000x1000/39/96/refresh-or-reload-symbol-blue-circular-arrow-vector-21433996.jpg)) that appeared next to my file, thinking that clicking that button was needed to actually upload the file. Instead, that was an "undo" button that restored the old version of my paper.

This behavior was counterintuitive _for me_ and the UI didn't lead me to do the right thing. Of course it's a totally subjective matter and maybe other people don't have the same misconception.
I'm suggesting better communication in the UI of the consequences of my actions.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '....'
3. Scroll down to '....'
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
A feedback box with a message describing the result of my action, such as "File restored".

title: External IDs in contributions not shown on conference contribution pages
body:
When defining "External ID Types" in the admin area, event organizers can add those external IDs to (sub-)contributions.
We correctly show them in the meeting-like timetable, but not on the contribution detail page in a 'conference' event.

Have a look at the `render_references` jinja macro how we render them in meetings. Not sure if the same style is nice in conferences ({contribution,subcontribution}_display.html), but we should show this information there as well.

title: A timezone which leads to "day-wrapping" seems to confuse the timetable rendering code
body:
**Describe the bug**

This happened in an event happening in `Europe/Zurich` as seen in `Asia/Seoul`.

e.g. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2699/117990951-e87fd200-b33d-11eb-83f1-af8664afa3bf.png)

becomes:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2699/117991075-03eadd00-b33e-11eb-93bf-bff4f5eb138b.png)

Which seems OK, only that the second day is incorrectly rendered:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2699/117991168-182eda00-b33e-11eb-8ff9-552156b35ce4.png)

(that last green block should have been at midnight)

In detailed view things get even worse:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2699/117991386-47dde200-b33e-11eb-9a95-dc9f4d669ddd.png)

becomes:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2699/117991672-8ffd0480-b33e-11eb-91ac-da6699987133.png)(these should be on Tuesday, not here)
[plus, further down the page...]

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2699/117991515-68a63780-b33e-11eb-8d45-3be8a93f8364.png)

(only this last part is correct)


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open https://indico.cern.ch/event/1016060/timetable/#20210510;
2. Set your timezone to `Asia/Seoul`;
3. You will notice the timetable is a bit of a mess.

**Expected behavior**

The time should be offset of 7h, with the "first day" of the event starting at  21:00 and finishing already on Tuesday (at 1:10 local time). The last two talks of the day should be shown on the day after.

**Additional context**
Reported at CERN, through `INC2786935`

title: Ellipsize overflowing plugin version numbers
body:
When a plugin has a non-standard version number (e.g. due to`--add-version-suffix` when building it), it looks quite ugly in the plugin overview (`/admin/plugins/`):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/179599/113687436-99a0a600-96c8-11eb-92a5-0d616bbad1aa.png)

- [x] Participant roles: Horizontal scrollbar as soon as there's a vertical scroll bar:

title: Multi-select of participants not possible (any more)
body:
**Describe the bug**
https://indico.cta-observatory.org/event/*/manage/registration/*/registrations/ does not allow to add multiple users from the "favourites" list in the "add Indico user" dialogue (started from Register::IndicoUser dropdown menu).

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to https://indico.cta-observatory.org/event/*/manage/registration/*/registrations of your favourite test event (after activating participant registration eventually).
2. Click on 'Register', then 'Indico User`
3. Click on one user in the list of favourite users. 
4. Try to add a second (and third), e.g. by Ctrl-click
5. The first selected user is unselected. This did not happen before.

**Expected behavior**
This did not happen in Indico 1 and before, probably I also used in earlier Indico 2 version, I do not remember exactly.
I see no reason to remove the multi-select feature. Or did I miss how it works now (not Ctrl-click anyway)?

title: Unexpected label behaviour when approving blockings
body:
In room booking, after creating a blocking, the label for the accept button is misplaced and flickers.
This sometimes makes it difficult to actually click and approve the blocking.

![rb](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12183954/100242914-3ab66d80-2f2d-11eb-9661-b274f49d265f.gif)

title: How to group session contributions in detailed view
body: **Describe the bug** we have a relatively simple conference event with two parallel sessions. When putting in contributions, we noticed that the detailed view does not keep contributions in one session together int the same column. Eg see the screenshot. We can "fix" by removing gaps in the timetable. However, are there other approaches we can use to keep the contributions in a session in the same column with parallel sessions? **To Reproduce** https://indico.cern.ch/event/941278/timetable/#20201123.detailed and change the Geant4 talk to be 20 minutes long.. **Expected behavior** contributions in a session should appear in the same column **Screenshots** **Additional context** Add any other context about the problem here.

title: List/paragraph margins in contribution notes/descriptions look weird
body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/179599/96689171-53f25a00-1382-11eb-9b95-c88dac191d27.png) I think it's mostly coming from the margin-bottom on `p` elements. See the details below for the markdown/html:
### Description Markdown: ```markdown * first * foo * bar * second * foo * bar --- * first * foo * bar * second * foo * bar --- **first** * foo * bar **second** * foo * bar ``` ### Minutes HTML: ```html

  • first

    • foo
    • bar

  • second

    • foo
    • bar
  • first
    • foo
    • bar
  • second
    • foo
    • bar

first

  • foo
  • bar

second

  • foo
  • bar
```

title: Minutes positioning breaks when content is too large
body:
When adding content to a meeting's minutes, the positioning might break if a single element is too large.

![bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12183954/95310544-d2340400-088c-11eb-88df-ce6445502582.png)

title: Removing entry of Division from Room Details does not work
body:
**Describe the bug**
The entry of the non mandatory field Division from the room details can not be removed.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to the 'Edit Room Details' of a room that contains Division information.
2. Remove the Entry.
3. Click Save.
4. The message "Room has been successfully updated." appears
5. The old value of division is back again (both in the edit view and the room list)

**Workaround**
As a workaround I inserted a non breaking space (U+00A0) via copy paste into the field, as a normal white space does not work. The division field disappears from the room list and the division field in the edit dialog is now empty. Not sure if this behavior is an additional bug.

**Expected behavior**
The old value of division is removed when cleared in the edit room details form and saved.

**Additional context**
indico 2.2.8 is installed via pip.

title: Additional comments in a revision do not show up
body:
Introduced by #4510

title: `moment()` sometimes uses an instance with no locale configured
body:
This happens e.g. in the event cloning dialog when previewing the dates on which the cloned events will take place when cloning with a pattern. Since it uses the default `en` locale it's using `mm/dd/yyyy` format instead of `dd/mm/yyyy` or whatever the locale uses.

`window.moment !== moment` in there, and when checking with the browser's dev tools the non-global moment is coming from another scope, so it's most likely caused by the webpack ProvidesPlugin we're using:

```js
      new webpack.ProvidePlugin({
        _: ['underscore', 'default'],
        moment: 'moment',
      }),
```

title: Save button not enabled when adding a room in a location

milestone.title: v2.2
milestone.description: A rewrite of the Room Booking Module UI, which will allow us to stop depending on Mako and remove a good amount of legacy JS code. We'll be introducing React, Redux and Semantic UI React.

body:
**Describe the bug**
In the room booking system, add a room in a location.  In the "Add Room" dialog there are some fields marked with red asterisk which is required.  However the save button would not be enabled even all the fields were filled.  I also *need to* fill both "Longitude" and "Latitude" then the save button will be enabled, and will keep enabled even I remove the value in Longitude and Latitude.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to Room booking system
2. Click on 'Administration'
3. Click on a pre-defined location and click "Add room"
4. In the "Add Room" dialog the save button is disabled until I fill both Longitude and Latitude


**Expected behavior**
I should be able to save the room without filling the Longitude and Latitude

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/179599/67635434-8f6d5c00-f8c7-11e9-9eec-84e52ada30c6.png)

title: Fix validation on latitude/longitude fields when editing rooms

milestone.title: v2.2
milestone.description: A rewrite of the Room Booking Module UI, which will allow us to stop depending on Mako and remove a good amount of legacy JS code. We'll be introducing React, Redux and Semantic UI React.

body:
Currently they don't specify any `step`, so the default step is `1`. This of course doesn't work well for coordinates (Firefox: validation error after editing; Edge: validation error when just submitting the form w/o changing the coordinates), so we can either:

- specify `step="0.000000001"` (with a reasonable amount of zeroes) or
- use a normal `type="text"` field

I think using a text field is the better option here, since having the up/down arrows for number input fields isn't useful in this case either.

title: Invalid URL when booking a room for a multi-days event

milestone.title: v2.2
milestone.description: A rewrite of the Room Booking Module UI, which will allow us to stop depending on Mako and remove a good amount of legacy JS code. We'll be introducing React, Redux and Semantic UI React.

body:
**Describe the bug**

When trying to book a room for multi-days event ('Book' on the Event in Room Booking in Event management), the URL created is for a daily booking from the first day to the last day of the meeting, from the time of the start of the meeting to the time of the end of the meeting.
This work well if the meeting starts and ends every day at the same time, but for a meeting which starts one day after lunch and ends on a following day before lunch the time selected has it's end before its start...

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create an event starting on day X at 13:30 and ending at day X+n at 12:30
2. Click on 'Room Booking'
3. Click 'Book'
4. See error: `Something went wrong The provided URL was not properly formatted.`

**Expected behavior**
Well, the correct behavior is difficult to define, as the timeslots of the room booking for daily booking don't really match the event boundaries. At least I'm expecting not to get an error.
A solution could be to give the option to give links to book days independently if they don't start/end at the same time?

**To Reproduce**

- in the page https://agenda.infn.it/event/18661/timetable/?print=1&view=standard which appears as a result searching on Google for the event;
- in the timetable page when the manager of the event chooses some of the themes for it, like the "Indico style".

**Expected behavior**
The names of the pending people should not appear anywhere.

milestone.title: v2.2
milestone.description: A rewrite of the Room Booking Module UI, which will allow us to stop depending on Mako and remove a good amount of legacy JS code. We'll be introducing React, Redux and Semantic UI React.

body:
**Describe the bug**
When editing booking (only dates), conflicts with past occurrences show up.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create recurrent booking that starts in the past and ends in the future
2. Cancel one of the past occurrences
3. Create a single booking when the occurrence in step 2 was

Edit should happen without any conflict.

title: Meeting pages look funny
body:
`{% set previous_date = date %}` at the end of a loop to check whether the value changed since the last iteration only worked because of a jinja bug (cross-loop sets were never supposed to work), which has been fixed in Jinja 2.9.

There are currently various workarounds that are more or less ugly (mutable objects with the `do` extension, or the groupby filter), but possibly there will be a clean solution to access the previous loop item in Jinja until 1.9.10 is ready for production.

Related jinja issue: pallets/jinja#641

![funny](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/179599/22471432/98887486-e7d2-11e6-9d22-dfec085849ca.png)

title: "Copy link" doesn't work after uploading an image
body:
When uploading images via the event image uploader we reload the image list with AJAX. The clipboard JS only runs once on dom ready though so clicking the link button will just open the image instead of copying the link to the clipboard.

Possible solutions:
- trigger indico:htmlUpdated and listen to that event in the clipboard code and apply the clipboard logic on elements where that event is triggered
- check whether we can tell the clipboard library to create a delegate on the document itself so it works with new elements. (maybe ask the developer of it in a github issue in their repo)

```
*doi:10.1088/1742-6596/664/8/082028
```

To quickly reproduce it try to modify abstract `13` on event `505613`.

title: Wrong users added instead of contributors.
body:
This is a bug that is present for a long time, at least from version 0.98.1, and it is still present in Indico 1.2.1rc2.

The bug shows itself when you try to add a manager that is not a real user, only a contributor.
The contributor id, which is a small number like 0, 1, 2 and so on, is used as a user id.
So usually you end up adding the main administrators or one of the first created users with id 1,2,3
instead of the contributor.

I think the bug is that the search dialog for users offers contributors. Contributors who do not have accounts cannot log into Indico and cannot manage anything, so there si no point in adding them as managers.

The attached screen shots show I  tried to add a contributor named Carretero as a manager, but Martin Kuba (me, the user with id 0) was added instead.

![adding_manager_indico121rc2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10230702/12743106/ba26e070-c98b-11e5-82d1-c514bb685a0c.png)
![added_manager_indico121rc2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10230702/12743108/bf998ec2-c98b-11e5-8e37-a444ce55cb20.png)

title: Registration form "add section" constructs incorrect URL
body:
I'm running indico 1.9.6, and I'm trying to add a new section to a registration form for a conference.  While editing the registration form, I can click on Add New --> Section, and I'm prompted for the title of the new section and I can click "Add", but the new section never appears.

A similar thing happens when I try to use the "+" to add a new field.  The operation doesn't appear to fail, but the new field doesn't appear.

 My site has a name like "http://example.com/indico".  Looking at the httpd access logs, I see that most requests ask for "/indico/...", but the POST that attempts to add a new section asks for "/event/...", leaving off the "/indico", and getting a 404 error.  Looking through the code, I don't see where this request is constructed.

For now, I've worked around the bug by using an Apache mod_rewrite rule to rewrite the bad URL.  With that change, sections can be added with no problem.

title: Client-side validation for time input field (Safari)
body:
The time input field [doesn't work well on Safari](http://caniuse.com/#feat=input-pattern), since it allows free text and it's not restricted to a pair of digits.
This creates problems as people may enter whatever they want, leading to error reports.
We need to check if there is an easy way to implement a client-side validation for the time input field [1]. Server-side validation would lead to loss of data when the form is submitted.

[1]: Maybe `patternMismatch` can help: http://www.html5rocks.com/en/tutorials/forms/constraintvalidation/

title: PDF files uploaded with wrong content type
body:
It seems some PDF files are uploaded with `application/x-download` as content type. It seems caused by some weird configuration in [pretty old](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=373621) versions of Firefox. There are currently over 200 instances of this issue in the production DB. Trying to preview the file causes an error since the content type is not supported.

I see two possible lines of action:
- Support `application/x-download` in the PDF previewer.
- Translate `application/x-download` to `application/pdf` on upload.

title: Plugin badges broken if there's a long word in the plugin name
body:
E.g. a plugin named "Webcast/Recording Request". "Webcast/Recording" is considered one word so it's not wrapped.

One solution would be using `text-overflow: ellipsis` and showing the full title in a tooltip. Another one would be using `word-wrap: break-word` but that looks quite ugly since there's no hyphenation.

title: Buttons for material download broken (sessions)
body:
When we have a session split across two different days (2 slots) and 2 more resources of the same material type, the "dropdown list" will only work for the first one. This happens because the IDs of the dom elements collide:

https://github.com/indico/indico/blob/master/indico/MaKaC/webinterface/tpls/events/include/Material.tpl#L19

title: Reservations in the future can't be modified to an earlier date
body:
When trying to modify a reservation, users can't select a day prior to the day the reservation was initially created for because the days in the calendar appear grayed out.

This is what happens:

```
Today |----------- invalid dates -----------| Reservation |------------ valid dates
19 Jan                                          12 Feb
```

This is what should happen:

```
Today |------------ valid dates ------------| Reservation |------------ valid dates
19 Jan                                          12 Feb
```

title: Non bookable periods are not displayed nor checked on the view
body:
Non bookable periods are similar to blockings as they prevent reservations to be created. However, we don't display them in any calendar view nor do any check for them during the reservation workflow. This leads to people trying to book rooms that are not bookable and then getting an error in the last step because no occurrences could be created for that day without giving any particular reason as to why.

We should:
- [x] Add visual feedback in the calendar view (similar to blockings maybe?)
- [x] Prevent people to go past the second step of the reservation workflow
## Screenshots

The room is unavailable for that day but it show up normally. The green bar can be clicked and brings you to the next page. 

![screenshot from 2015-01-13 10 44 15](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/716307/5718797/da52b4a4-9b11-11e4-8b82-e8f0e8de1988.png)

On the next page, one can try to pre/book and the error dialog pops up when the server creates no occurrences for the reservation.

![unnamed](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/716307/5718807/fc11abcc-9b11-11e4-85a1-5469314f35c2.png)

title: Don't lose all input after a HTML security error in PR assessment comments
body:
When commenting on a Paper (Paper Reviewing => Assess content) using disallowed HTML tags in the comment results in a HTML security error. This is the correct behavior, but it currently clears the textarea, so the whole comment is lost even though it would be easy for the user to fix the actual issue.
- [x] Preserve the entered text in case of an error so the user can correct it.
- [ ] If we do not render the comments as HTML anywhere, we could disable the HTML security check for them - it doesn't make much sense to do this for plaintext data.

title: Unexpected behavior when editing session slot start time
body:
``` yaml
# Ticket imported from Trac
```

The validation of start time modification of a session slot in the timetable view is not working as expected when there are contributions living inside. 

To reproduce the issue, first assume the following session:

```
14:00 --- Session start ---
    14:10 ~ 15:00 Contribution
15:00 --- Session end ---
```

Trying to modify the start time of the session from 14:00 to 14:10 triggers an error dialog with the following message:

  The session slot cannot end at (2014-10-12 14:50) because there is a contribution (2014-10-12 15:00) ending after that time.

So it seems that instead of pushing back by 10 minutes the end time, we are doing the opposite and thus triggering the error message.

This problem is reproducible both from the session details qtip and basic edition dialog.

title: Problem reusing Vidyo Room (attach room)

milestone.title: v1.2
milestone.description:

* Offline website creation

* New URL schema
* Many UX improvements

body:
``` yaml
# Ticket imported from Trac
```

[From ARP]:

Problem:
1. We have the meeting A, with the Vidyo room called "Vidyo_A" and a PIN "1111".
2. We create the meeting B, and we try to create a Vidyo room "Vidyo_A" with a PIN "2222".
3. It will show up a popup to attach the existing meeting and you accept.
4. The new "booking" shows that the PIN is "2222" when is actually "1111"
5. If you click in refresh it will be updated to "1111" because it is the real one.

Solution:

Do not accept "2222", maintain the values as they were in the old meeting, but in the popup give a more detailed explanation, and fix the bug that shows 2222 after that.

title: Room Booking: Visual feedback for moderated rooms on list of rooms
body:
``` yaml
# Ticket imported from Trac
```

In previous versions of room listings we had three different kinds of rooms:
- Basic room: everybody can book
- Private room: restricted group can book
- Moderated room: booking requires confirmation from a room manager

In the current version there is no way to tell if the room is moderated (PRE-bookable only).

It should be rather easy to add an icon with a qtip indicating this fact. Even a more polished solution is adding this information as an attribute like ''"Video conference available"\* or *"private"'', so moderated rooms can also be filtered.

title: Usability issue with Room selector - free text
body:
``` yaml
# Ticket imported from Trac
```

Right now, when one writes down a room name instead of selecting it from the list, (s)he may be unknowingly breaking the behavior of the "Connect to room" button. The button will expect a normal room (referenced by ID) to be selected, whilst a free text name will just be ignored (and the feature disabled).

A possible solution could be auto-completing the room name, and making it clear (using an icon?) that a corresponding room has been found.

title: Search shows only one out of two users

milestone.title: v1.1
milestone.description:
* Indico mobile
* Room booking new face
* Many UX improvements

body:
``` yaml
# Ticket imported from Trac
```

When two users have identical e-mail addresses (maybe it is necessary that they have also identical last/first name, I did not check), then only one of them is displayed when searching on
 https://www.cta-observatory.org/indico/userList.py?sSurName=cheikh
(or equivalent) and other search dialogs in InDiCo.

That should (and hopefuly can) be changed rapidly.

While it is correct that new users cannot "reuse" an existing e-mail address, they may change their address afterwards. Thus it may happen that inactive accounts are displayed, while active accounts are "hidden" by the system. A merge (over HTTP) needs a working search, so it is not possible any more. (Well, a workaround is to change the address slightly for one record, and both appear again.)
Merge with indico_shell also works fine. But better fix the problem in the search result display.
